snippet: Ban Ki-Moon, the secretary general of the United Nations, said that he had been “informed in advance by the U.S. government” about the diplomatic breakthrough with Cuba.
abstract: Ban Ki-Moon, the secretary general of the United Nations, said that he had been “informed in advance by the U.S. government” about the diplomatic breakthrough with Cuba.

byline.original: By SOMINI SENGUPTA and ROBERT MACKEY

headline.main: U.N. Secretary General Knew Breakthrough Was Coming
